My aftershockz aeropex bone conduction headphones do a better job and lasts my whole 10 hour workday without needing to be charged.Maybe another software update with automatic multipoint switching, adjust the eq curve to have more low end and not cap the bass when playing at a higher volume, and drop the price and they would an awesome product.Update 3/12/2024So I returned my first pair of ultra earbuds, and got a set of Shokz open fit earbuds.  I tried those on for some time and really like how they performed overall.  But somehow I started to miss the bose earbuds, and wanted to compare how they went up against the Shokz offering.  The price is still steep, but I had an amazon gift card balance of $157 so I went ahead and bought the Bose to do the comparison.The fit was excellent as before, the sound is excellent, I registered them to get the two year nose warranty as I can see these being replaced sometime in September the future.  The Shokz are really good and probably rank them as one of the best hook buds in the market.  For me and my ears, the Bose and the Shokz are an excellent buy.  They both are light and fitment is excellent, the sound is superb, the call quality I give to Shokz, the update happened to both and somehow the call quality on the bose really improved.  I still prefer the physical button over the touch sensitive approach that Shokz went with.  I still like the Bose ear cuff design vs the earhook.  So which do I prefer.  Running and exercising-Bose without a doubt, mountain biking and any sport with a lot of wind noise-Shokz hands down.3/19/2024I started noticing the Bose ultra open buds starting to lose connection when putting them on.  The right ear would get the connected prompts, but the left would not connect and when it does connect, it loses drops connection a couple of time more than connects and syncs up with the right ear.  I’m going to request for a replacement pair.  Overall, these are excellent buys if you have a gift card balance to buy down these buds.  The Shokz were on sale so I returned my black pair and got the white pair.  I had some Amazon credits and used those credits to buy the Shokz at much lower price.3/29/2024Bose pushed an update to the open ultras (version 1.10.4).  The audio sounded clearer, the connection issue seems to have been resolved, I noticed while doing yard work that my Bose lasted approximately 5 hours on the immersion setting.  No multipoint connectivity like the Shokz open fits have.  Also,  I saw that Bose released a wireless charging case on their website for $50.  I decided to not get the wireless charging case because I was already used to the usb-c plug approach.

I received the Bose Open Earbuds a week ago after ordering from Amazon, delivery was quick and the next morning I was opening my new buds and preparing to put them through their paces, I own many other brands of earbuds from all over the world, even open earbuds from other brands.Unboxing was pretty straightforward. The only things in the box were the earbuds, the case, and a USB-A to USB-C cable. The case feels premium, along the line of other cases I have from other premium earbuds. The case feels comfortable to hold, easy to carry in my pocket. What stands out to me with the case is the lights, I’m not exactly sure why, but when you place the buds in the case and the lights are lit up I really like how that looks. I also like there were no ear tips included, there were none of those here. No fitting the different ear tips then unsure if I have the right ones selected.I was not used to just setting something into my ear and not worrying trying to completely seal up my ear canal. Once I got used to setting these in my ears, it was well worth it. I really didn’t even feel them on my ear. No feeling the pressure that builds up with a sealed ear canal, no popping them out to hear someone talking to me, no uncomfortable feelings at all. According to the website it shows most people wearing them high up on their ears, but for me they fit, feel and sound better down lower on my ears. You just set the earbud into your ear, wrap the elastic part around the bottom of my ear and away you go. I enjoy the best of both worlds, I have my music or my audio books with me wherever I want to go without worrying about the what I cannot hear while crossing the parking lot. I wear these in the park for my morning walk, and don’t get that paranoid feeling that someone is walking up behind me like I do with noise cancelling ear sealing headphones. I can still hear the important things going on around me.The sound is fantastic! I really like music on these. The charge lasts a good portion of the day, I haven’t had any problems yet with them running out of battery. They’re IPX4 rated, so I’m not worried about wearing them while I work out. And I’m surely not worried about having them fall out, I tried my best and couldn’t shake them out. They’re not multi-point capable yet, supposed to come as a software update. But I’m happy with that, I have had enough run ins where I’m listening to a book on my phone then start playing a game on my tablet and having to fight to make sure the sound is coming from the device I want it to come from.Overall these are great earbuds, flew right to the top of my list and are my favorite now. And I have the top of the line earbuds from several different manufacturers. The let me have music and stay connected to the world, something I have come to really appreciate.

product_name: Bose QuietComfort Ultra True Wireless Noise Cancelling In-Ear Earbuds - Black (Renewed)

reviews.review: I use to have airpod pros, so when it comes to these in my opinion there is no comparison these are simply better. So they are a little bulky (i have small ears, but they fit me pretty good) and they are suprisingly quite comfortable, thankfully it comes with different size eartips so adjustment is there.ANC is on these is actually crazy i can't hear a thing when it's on i've tried other earbuds these are fantastic, Aware mode is really good too no complaints. The audio quality is extremely good the app comes with an eq so that's good (app is slow tho haha)  the modes are insane too except immersive i personally didn't like it on these earbuds, i don't know if it's a new feature on these earphones but to me it ain't it. Refurbished is the way to go cuz 300$ is wild. Overall best earbuds i've ever had

How could this product be bad ,its Bose right ? I have a Bose set of lesser value that I have loved and thought this was going to be an upgrade of great proportions. I couldn't be more wrong. Bass Boost ? None .. Tinty sound and I spent hrs trying you adjust.  Noise canceling? I use my earbuds mosting for cycling as I ride 2hrs on the road. I could not even tell what song was playing . Very disappointed with this product.  I bought a set of Bose for 100 dollars 6 years ago and this Ultra set really lowered the bar when to wanting great sound.... Im returning for refund and No Stars !!!
These are the best ear buds I’ve experiencedNoise canceling is unbelievableSound is incredibleWorth every penny.

Probably one of the best fitting headphones in the market. Amazing sound and overall quality. Good for music and games on your device.Not good for phone calls, noise cancellation during calls is not good, picks up outside sounds and cuts the voice of other persons on the line.

- Amazon-renewed version fails often: 4 pairs in less than 6 months. Technically 5 because semi-last shipment mysteriously was a children's $5 item rather than my headphones.- Requires Bose app which is NOT privacy-friendly per my analysis of the app's internet connection data.- Has ongoing microphone issues: bad quality/static during many calls. Well known to Bose for years. No fixes available.- This 5th pair is "Josh's headphones". Tells me everything I suspected about Amazon's refurbishing quality. At least there's no earwax, so... 2 stars I guess.Pros: best ANC, period. Silences even people's voices and actually negates common sounds in the real world, unlike my experience with Google Buds Pro 2. ANC is even better than the Sony WF-1000XM5, which are even more expensive.Moral of the story: wifi headphones are a mess. Refurbished Bose is hit and miss.... and miss.... and miss....ad infinitum.

Its one of the BEST earbuds ever but please purchase it with some insurance. This is my second pair. I love them because the immersive mode (spatial audio) is very good, so is noise cancelling. On phone calls, it does tend to pick up background noises, though

Disaster ... I lost my apple earpods.  Looked everywhere and can not find them.  So, shopped for a replacement.  Came across these Bose earbuds, and did some deep research on them.  I really did not especially want to pay this much for a new set of earbuds, but I have always been impressed with any Bose product I have used in the past.  Found the "renewed" buds, so decided to give it a try.  Here are some things to know ... these are the best earbuds I have ever used.  Period.  Extremely comfortable.  And the overall sound is unlike anything I have used in the past.  It is deep, rich sound.  Great bass.  And the "immersion" setting puts you right in the middle of the band.  Plus, it has the best noise cancelation feature I have ever used.  I simply love these buds.  Only downside is ... the description says it comes with the "fit kit" so you can get just the right fit.  This is a lie.  No instructions.  No fit kit.  Just the case, buds and a short cable.  And there is no way I could find to contact the seller.  So, I contacted Bose, and they sent me out a fit kit for free.  But what a hassle.  I would have knocked a star off for it, except it is not the earbud's issue, it is the seller.  And these earbuds will change your life.  Totally worth the big bucks.***UPDATE*** 11/27/24:  I continue to love the earbuds for regular use, but have knocked down my rating to 3 stars.  Reason being that I have learned that when making or receiving a phone call, the earbuds are next to worthless.  The sound quality is very faint and it is hard to hear the caller.  Researched this on Google, and this appears to be a very common issue without an easy solution.  I will be calling Bose to see if they can help with it or to exchange this headset for one that functions correctly.  Very disappointing.

Simply put, these are the best in-ear bluetooth phones I have. I know that for some people they sound too bass-heavy but that's exactly what I was looking for. Sony and Sennheiser are more natural but I like my music punchy.In calls they are just as perfect.Connection stability is supreme, control are very easy because the touch zone covers the whole earbud.Comfy and not jotting out like Sony's or Jabra's. Running on treadmill at 11 speed and no tilt.Immersive mode is brilliant. Noise canceling is the best I've ever seen. My desktop computer sounds like a Boeing Jet when I do renders or post production but as soon as I put on my Bose's, all is calm and quiet. In "aware" mode, I can still clearly hear outside world with a lowered volume and listen to my music to my heart's desire. I used aware mode in my band practice jam sessions and I can clearly distinguish and hear both the track in my ears and my own drum playing.That said, if you are looking for in-ear monitors, go for Shure. Like I said these are pretty bass-heavy so you won't be hearing your songs as others probably will.

product_name: Skullcandy Method 360 ANC Wireless Earbuds, Sound by Bose, Bluetooth Headphones, Premium Noise Cancelling, Up to 40 Hrs Battery, Sweat and Water Resistant, Microphone for iPhone Android - True Black

reviews.review: I'd used many models in the Samsung Galaxy Buds lineup, the last being a couple pairs of the Buds 2 Pros. While I liked the Samung earbuds, I put about 30 hours of use on the headphones weekly and they never held up for more than 3 or 4 months. One earbud (most always the right) would lose volume and quality until it failed to produce listenable sound at all. I'd use the Samung warranty, then the extended warranty that I'd purchased, then buy another pair and start over. Which each new model I'd hoped Samung had fixed the durability issues, but they never had, so I finally decided to try something new.In comes the Method 360s. I've been using these guys for nearly a year now and they haven't lost sound volume or quality in the slightest. While the higher frequencies might not be quite as clear or expansive as the Buds 2 Pros, I think they sound great for the price and I love their punchy bass. The volume on the highest setting also seems to be a little louder than other earbuds that I've had, which can be nice.I'm not impressed with their ANC. I hardly notice it compared to my Bose over-the-ear headphones, but it's not an issue when paired with their passive noise cancelation and I wasn't impressed with the Buds 2 Pros ANC, either. I have some connectivity issues here and there where one bud won't pair with my Samsung phone out of the case. I'll put the earbud back in the case and take it out again and then I'm good to go. I've never lost Bluetooth connection once paired.All in all, I think these are good buds for a good priceI finally decided to try something else and that's where these

I love the sound of it. Lots of bass!!! Great noise cancelling. I’ve been struggling to find a phone that is comfortable enough and don’t fall of my ear during activities. This earphone sits very well on the ears and stay stuck until you want them loose. Definitely this thing is a masterpiece for the price and potential competitors.

So these are like Bose QC earbuds II same design and feel to them so if you ever seen or used them that's how it out of the case. The case is a bit weird it's a long case that slides up and down and each side is marked with R and L to tell which side each earbud goes to. The positives are the sound is amazing and anc is very good I use them at 40 to 50 percent volume and it blocks out a lot of sound. The charging is pretty fast about 20 minutes and I get an hour and some minutes back to listen to them again and these are very comfortable and come with 3 size options and are able it a good amount of colors to purchase and it has an option to connect to your email for fast connection to any device that uses that certain email which is cool. Another great thing is single earbud can use anc option which I use daily since my job only allows one earbud in and works great.Negatives are small in my opinion one is the battery life is a lie with anc on it lasts about 6.5 hours not 9 like it was registered on the list and I know because I usually work long shifts and about half way I have to charge up and second issue is with both earbuds in is stuttering this comes up at small intervals and it's annoying hearing skips in songs or video if you're in crowded place or on a walk and I think it has to do with Bluetooth connection not going through multiple channels and skull app is useless so I tried to fix by using their methods to attempt a fix and it still happens so I think it's a bad Bluetooth connection and I looked online and seen other people complaining about this issue.So in the end if skullcandy could fix the connection stutters and their own app to get this small issue to go away I would rate them 5 out 5 but it ain't it gots some issues like I mentioned above but it's like a good alternative to a cheaper version of the Bose QC earbuds II

Sounds quality is great, fitment is great, and connectivity for me was a breeze with no drops at all.I hit the gym with these 3 days in a row now with zero issues. The fitment is snug and no need for readjustment during my 1.5 hour gym sessions which also includes running the treadmill. The earbud silicone pieces do not get stuck in my ears or slide off the earbuds at all. I'm assuming people who complain about the silicone coming off/undone must be user error or improperly installed.Bluetooth connection for me has been solid on my Google Pixel 7 Pro, including my friends iPhone 16 Pro Max. I did download the Skullcandy IQ app which prompt me for an update that I did. No connectivity issues at all so far.My battery life is currently at 97% with 3 days worth of gym use at about 1.5hrs per day at medium to medium/high volume with ANC turned off (from fully charged).The case is on the bulky side, however, it's easy to use. People complaining about how difficult/annoying it is to put the earbuds back in the case are simple minded. All you have to do is literally look at the orientation of the ear buds upon removal and put them back the exact same way. I guess people need something to complain about.I'd absolutely recommend these earbuds, especially over the air pods, beats, or SoundCloud. Wait for a sale or buy them used like I did.

product_name: Bose QuietComfort Ultra Bluetooth Earbuds, Wireless Earbuds, Deep Bass, Up to 6 Hours of Playtime and World-Class Active Noise Cancellation Bundle with USB-C/A 20W Wall Charger (Black)

reviews.review: Exceptional Sound & Value!!
Absolutely the best! I love the battery life and the noise reduction. I travel a lot and these are my go to earbuds. I have several apple,Bose earbuds and these are my go to

I have painfully sensitive hearing. The first pair of these i tried would make an intermittent squeal in the left earbud. I tried 4 more pairs, 2 directly from bose, and they all had the same issue across different devices & OS's. I also had constant connectivity issues.If you use earbuds for the ANC, skip these. They are basically unusable. (I suggest going back a generation for noise cancellation, if you can.)
Outstanding sound and easy to use. I wish the mic quality was a little better. However for listening. I’d highly recomend.
Great everything about them is great…for me

Para lo costosos que son, la batería dura como 4 a 5 horas ! Aparte que no es anti ruido porque trabajo en un sitio donde hacen bulla y me coloco estos auriculares y sigo escuchando el ruido de afuera !Lo que sí no se le puede negar es que el sonido es brutal me encanta !
Really comfortable and easy to use
2 weeks in and 1 earbud wouldn't charge to 100%. Loses connection intermittently with Bluetooth. And case doesn't hold a charge long. Great noise canceling! Amazing sound.
